title: 107_hr993
content:
In fiscal years 2002-2006, the Attorney General must increase the number of personnel combating alien smuggling by at least 50 positions annually. Additionally, criminal sentences and fines for alien smuggling will be increased. The United States Sentencing Commission will amend sentencing guidelines for alien smuggling, increasing minimum prison terms and fines based on the number of aliens involved. The United States Sentencing Commission will amend sentencing guidelines for alien smuggling by increasing fines and prison terms based on the number of aliens involved. This includes increasing fines to twice the amount received for the illegal activity and enhancing sentencing for causing bodily injury or death. Exceptions apply for offenses committed non-profit or involving only the defendant's spouse or child. Exceptions apply for offenses involving only the defendant's spouse or child. SEC. 3. ELIMINATION OF PENALTY ON PERSONS RENDERING EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE. Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to eliminate penalties for individuals providing emergency assistance to aliens in life-threatening circumstances. Effective 90 days after enactment. 

SEC. 4. AMENDMENTS TO SENTENCING GUIDELINES REGARDING THE EFFECT OF PROSECUTORIAL POLICIES. The United States Sentencing Commission will amend the Federal sentencing guidelines to address plea bargaining and prosecutorial policies, stating that differences in policies among districts should not affect sentencing. Additionally, there will be enhanced penalties for individuals committing offenses while armed. The amendments to Section 924(c)(1) of title 18, United States Code, include adding violations of section 274(a)(1)(A) of the Immigration and Nationality Act as offenses subject to enhanced penalties. These changes will take effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The amendments to Section 924(c)(1) of title 18, United States Code, will take effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act and apply to offenses committed after that 90-day period. SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations for Immigration and Naturalization Service to conduct undercover investigations and prosecute alien smuggling violations. Funds are authorized to be appropriated for this purpose and remain available until expended. SEC. 7. Defines "alien smuggling" as prohibited acts under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
